% For making index
\newcommand{\IX}[1]{\index{\protect {#1}}#1}
%
%
\newcommand{\FLfunction}[4]{\item{\bf #1}\\{Type:\  \it #2}\\{Usage: \bf #3}\\ #4}
\newcommand{\FLcommand}[3]{\item{\bf #1}\\{Usage: \bf #2}\\ #3}
\newcommand{\funarrow}{\mbox{$\rightarrow$}}
%

%% For EPS figures
\input epsf
\newcommand{\FIG}[3]{
    \begin{figure}[hbt]
    \begin{center}
    \leavevmode
    \epsffile{figs/#1.eps}
    \caption{#2}
    \label{#3}
    \end{center}
    \end{figure}
}

% Figure macro for figures generated by gpic -t
%
% TEXfigure{filename}{caption}
%
\newcommand{\TEXfigure}[2]{     % Normal sized in-line figures
        \begin{figure}[htb]
        \begin{center}
        \leavevmode
        \input{tex_figs/#1.tex}
        \centerline{\raise 1em\box\graph}
        \caption{\protect #2}
        \label{#1}
        \end{center}
        \end{figure}
}

\newcommand{\fig}[1]{\mbox{Fig.~\protect\ref{#1}}}  
\newcommand{\Fig}[1]{\mbox{Figure~\protect\ref{#1}}}
\newcommand{\figs}[1]{\mbox{Figs.~\protect\ref{#1}}}
\newcommand{\Figs}[1]{\mbox{Figures~\protect\ref{#1}}}

\newcommand{\LFIG}[3]{
    \begin{figure}[hbtp]
    \begin{center}
    \input figs/#1.latex
    \caption{#2}
    \label{#3}
    \end{center}
    \end{figure}
}
